abstract.p: South Korea's Watchdog Financial Supervisory Commission says Kim Woo Choong, former chairman of Daewoo Group, and as many as 40 executives from conglomerate may face criminal charges for inflating asset values of several affiliates, which worsened assessment of business group's liabilities; Daewoo is being sold off in pieces to repay debts totaling $79 million; photo (S)

block.p: Kim Woo Choong, the former chairman of the Daewoo Group, and as many as 40 executives from the conglomerate may face criminal charges for inflating the asset values of several affiliates, which worsened the assessment of the business group's liabilities, the watchdog Financial Supervisory Commission said. Daewoo Group, which was at one time the second-largest business group in South Korea, is being sold off in pieces to repay debts totaling $79 billion. The state-run watchdog agency said it was considering possible penalties against accounting companies as well.
